title: I.Sicily inscription 000105
support: Large fragment of a substantial white marble block. The front face is partially preserved, as is a very small smoothly finished area of the reverse. The fragment is irregularly broken on all four sides. On the lower rear left there is an area of curved surface, running from the intact part of the rear face towards the front, which appears to be original. If this is so, then it is likely that only a small amount of stone is missing from the front left face (c.10cm?). Modern red paint has been applied around the sides of the stone. Dimensions are those of the preserved face.

layout.p: Parts of three lines of Latin letters, first line larger than the other two.

handNote.lettering: Neat v-cut letters with serifs, and triangular interpunct; open P.

provenanceFound._: Found 'fra le macerie di quell'antico castello'

provenanceObserved._: Prag 2023-07-06 in the storeroom of the Museo Civico

facsimile.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2023-07-06

museum.name: Museo Civico Baldassare Romano
museum.description: A large and well-displayed collection. It begins with three ante-rooms, in the first of which is a rich display of lithics (mainly Neolithic) from the surrounding area. A display of material from Himera (lion-head spouts from the Temple of Victory and red-figure craters being the principle pieces) and a numismatic gallery then follow before the main room which contains Hellenistic and Roman material from Termini Imerese itself. Small finds, sculpture and inscriptions predominate. The museum collection continues upstairs with non-archaeological material (and a single inscription). The courtyard of the building holds a large collection of architectural pieces and inscriptions

location.address: Via Marco Tullio Cicerone, 90018 - Termini Imerese (PA)

bibl.title: Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del museo civico di Termini Imerese
bibl.citation: Livia Bivona, Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del museo civico di Termini Imerese, vol. 9/8, Kokalos Supplementi / Sikelika serie storica (Palermo / Rome, 1994)
